title: WebsiteConfiguration
description:
Represents the configuration settings for a website crawler or scraper.
Defines parameters such as the name of the website, the starting URL,
maximum allowed levels and pages, specific URL patterns to process,
and connectors required for linking external components like LLMs and file systems.

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)

StartUrl.description:
Gets or sets the starting URL for the website.

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-starturl

MaxLevel.description:
Gets or sets the maximum level allowed for processing or operations in the website.

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-maxlevel

MaxPages.description:
Gets or sets the maximum number of pages to process for the website.

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-maxpages

Pages.description:
Gets or sets the collection of website pages configuration.

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-pages-list

items.description:
Represents a configuration for a web page that can be scraped. Provides various properties
to define the inclusion or exclusion of HTML and text content, as well as ways to filter
or process the extracted data.
items.x-example:
A WebsitePage may represent an individual section of a website, configured to extract specific
features or files based on its properties.

Name.description:
Represents the name of the web page or a specific element within the web page.

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-pages-list-name

TagName.description:
Represents the tag name of an HTML element or feature within a website page.

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-pages-list-tagname

Description.description:
Provides details or information about the web page or a specific element within the web page.

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-pages-list-description

IncludeHtml.description:
Indicates whether the HTML content of the web page should be included in the output during the web scraping process.

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-pages-list-includehtml

IncludeText.description:
Determines whether the textual content of a web page should be included during the web scraping process.

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-pages-list-includetext

NormalizeWhitespaces.description:
Indicates whether whitespaces should be normalized in the text content extracted from an HTML node.
When enabled, consecutive whitespace characters are replaced with a single space.

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-pages-list-normalizewhitespaces

RemoveHtmlTags.description:
Indicates whether HTML tags should be removed from the content of a web page during processing.

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-pages-list-removehtmltags

RemoveHtmlAttributes.description:
Indicates whether HTML attributes should be removed during the web scraping process.

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-pages-list-removehtmlattributes

UrlContains.description:
Filter to process only web pages whose URL contains the specified substring.
            

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-pages-list-urlcontains

ContainsText.description:
Only wepage contains text will be processed.
            

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-pages-list-containstext

ContainsXpath.description:
If defined, ContainsText will be checked only in the xpath.
            

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-pages-list-containsxpath

ContentXPath.description:
Only html tags from this xpath. If not empty.
            

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-pages-list-contentxpath

DisabledTags.description:
List of HTML tags that should be disabled or ignored during processing.
            

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-pages-list-disabledtags

Features.description:
Represents a collection of features extracted or associated with a specific web page,
defining key elements or properties of interest within the page.

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-pages-list-features-list

items.description:
Represents a specific feature of a website that can be targeted during web scraping.
This includes the ability to identify and extract corresponding data by configuring properties such as tag names,
regex patterns, XPath expressions, and HTML-processing parameters.

Name.description:
Gets or sets the name of the website feature.
Represents a descriptive identifier for a given feature within the website scraping process.

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-pages-list-features-list-name

TagName.description:
Gets or sets the tag name used to identify or categorize the website feature.
Represents an attribute or element type within the website structure, providing context for feature extraction or manipulation.

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-pages-list-features-list-tagname

NameRegex.description:
Gets or sets the regular expression pattern to identify the name component of a website feature.
This property allows for custom matching and extraction of specific name segments
from a website's content during the scraping process.

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-pages-list-features-list-nameregex

ValueRegex.description:
Gets or sets the regular expression used to extract specific value matches from the HTML content of a website.
This property allows for precise targeting of text or patterns within the scraped HTML data.

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-pages-list-features-list-valueregex

NameXpath.description:
Gets or sets the XPath expression used to locate the name of a specific feature within the website content.
Represents a structured query for extracting the name's specific location in the HTML document.

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-pages-list-features-list-namexpath

ValueXpath.description:
Gets or sets the XPath expression used to locate and extract the value of a specific feature within a website's HTML content.
Represents the path to the element containing the desired data.

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-pages-list-features-list-valuexpath

IncludeHtml.description:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the HTML content of the feature should be included in the output.
Determines if the raw HTML representation of a specific web feature is extracted and added to the feature's output during processing.

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-pages-list-features-list-includehtml

IncludeText.description:
Determines whether the text content of the website feature should be included in the output.
Controls whether the extracted plain text, processed via relevant scraping logic,
is added to the resulting feature output.

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-pages-list-features-list-includetext

NormalizeWhitespaces.description:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether whitespaces in the extracted content should be normalized.
When enabled, consecutive whitespace characters are collapsed into a single space,
facilitating cleaner and more standardized output after web scraping.

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-pages-list-features-list-normalizewhitespaces

RemoveHtmlTags.description:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether HTML tags should be removed from the content.
Determines if the raw HTML content will have tags stripped for plain text processing.

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-pages-list-features-list-removehtmltags

RemoveHtmlAttributes.description:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether HTML attributes should be removed during web scraping.
This property is primarily used to strip unnecessary attributes from HTML elements for cleaner and more optimized data extraction.

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-pages-list-features-list-removehtmlattributes

Files.description:
Represents a collection of files associated with the webpage for processing or extraction.

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-pages-list-files-list

items.description:
Represents a file associated with a website page.
This class is annotated with the HalGuruPathAttribute attribute, indicating its relationship within the hierarchical structure
of website configurations and pages.

Name.description:
Gets or sets the name of the website feature.
Represents a descriptive identifier for a given feature within the website scraping process.

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-pages-list-files-list-name

TagName.description:
Gets or sets the tag name used to identify or categorize the website feature.
Represents an attribute or element type within the website structure, providing context for feature extraction or manipulation.

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-pages-list-files-list-tagname

NameRegex.description:
Gets or sets the regular expression pattern to identify the name component of a website feature.
This property allows for custom matching and extraction of specific name segments
from a website's content during the scraping process.

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-pages-list-files-list-nameregex

UrlRegex.description:
Gets or sets the regular expression pattern for matching URLs associated with the website file.
Enables filtering or identification of specific URLs based on defined patterns within the file context.

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-pages-list-files-list-urlregex

NameXpath.description:
Gets or sets the XPath expression used to locate the name of a specific feature within the website content.
Represents a structured query for extracting the name's specific location in the HTML document.

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-pages-list-files-list-namexpath

UrlXpath.description:
Gets or sets the XPath expression used to extract the URL from a website file's content.
Specifies the selector for identifying the relevant URL within the HTML structure of a page.

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-pages-list-files-list-urlxpath

UrlsStartWith.description:
Gets or sets the collection of URL prefixes used to filter and process relevant URLs.

Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(website)-urlsstartwith-list
